result.execSummary:
The defendant Shannon E Ryan was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Repeater, Domestic Abuse], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).
  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Repeater], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt: DNA proof of submission form
w/Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief

Clerk Marisa.
Case Called: 3:43 pm 
INCLUDES 16CM1106, 16CM13, AND 16CM845. 
State appears by ADA Matt Adrian; Def appears in person with Atty Anne Renc.  
Plea Quest/Waiver of Rights filed. VRCW. 

State moves to: 
In 16CM1106: Ct. 2 (Misd. BJ/Repeater)>>D&RI. 
In 16CM845: Ct. 1 (Misd. BJ/Repeater)>>D&RI. 
COURT grants above. 

PLEA: 
In 16CM1106: Ct. 1 (Misd. BJ/Repeater)>>NO CONTEST. 
In 16CM13: Ct. 1 (DC/Repeater/DA)>>NO CONTEST. 
                   : Ct. 2 (DC/Repeater)>>NO CONTEST. 

COURT advises def of rights (including constitutional rights) & penalties & ques def to understanding.  
COURT finds plea & waiver of rights freely & vol made, a factual basis, & def guilty. 
Def makes statement. 

COURT ORDERS: 
In 16CM1106: Ct. 1 (Misd. BJ/Repeater)>>6 months MCJ with huber for work/school and 60 days to begin sentence; DNA sample and surcharge; CC. 
In 16CM13: Ct. 1 (DC/Repeater/DA)>>6 months MCJ with huber for work/school and 60 days to begin sentence; DNA sample and surcharge; CC including 1 DA surcharge. 
                   : Ct. 2 (DC/Repeater)>>6 months MCJ with huber for work/school and 60 days to begin sentence; DNA sample and surcharge; CC. 
COURT finds the def entitled to NO days jail credit. 
COURT ORDERS sentences to run CONCURRENT to each other. 
COURT gives def 60 days to pay costs or set up payment plan. 

Adj: 3:58 pm
Plea/sentencing hearing on November 4, 2016 at 03:30 pm.
Plea/sentencing hearing on November 4, 2016 at 08:15 am.
Status conference on September 14, 2016 at 03:20 pm.
Plea/sentencing hearing on August 31, 2016 at 09:30 am.

Clerk Marisa.

Contact, however, may be made through the defendant's attorney.
